trans-unit.source: Tell me about cloud services
trans-unit.target: Tell me about cloud services

trans-unit.source: Cloud Services is an example of Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS).
trans-unit.target: Cloud Services is an example of Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS).

trans-unit.source: Like [App Services](app-service-web-overview.md), this technology is designed to support applications that are scalable, reliable, and cheap to operate.
trans-unit.target: Like [App Services](app-service-web-overview.md), this technology is designed to support applications that are scalable, reliable, and cheap to operate.

trans-unit.source: Just like an [App Services](app-service-web-overview.md) are hosted on VMs, so too are Cloud Services, however, you have more control over the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Just like an [App Services](app-service-web-overview.md) are hosted on VMs, so too are Cloud Services, however, you have more control over the VMs.

trans-unit.source: You can install your own software on Cloud Service VMs and you can remote into them.
trans-unit.target: You can install your own software on Cloud Service VMs and you can remote into them.

trans-unit.source: More control also means less ease of use; unless you need the additional control options, it's typically quicker and easier to get a web application up and running in Web Apps in App Service compared to Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: More control also means less ease of use; unless you need the additional control options, it's typically quicker and easier to get a web application up and running in Web Apps in App Service compared to Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: The technology provides two slightly different VM options: instances of *web roles* run a variant of Windows Server with IIS, while instances of *worker roles* run the same Windows Server variant without IIS.
trans-unit.target: The technology provides two slightly different VM options: instances of *web roles* run a variant of Windows Server with IIS, while instances of *worker roles* run the same Windows Server variant without IIS.

trans-unit.source: A Cloud Services application relies on some combination of these two options.
trans-unit.target: A Cloud Services application relies on some combination of these two options.

trans-unit.source: Any combination of these two slightly different VM hosting options are available in a cloud service:
trans-unit.target: Any combination of these two slightly different VM hosting options are available in a cloud service:

trans-unit.source: **Web role**
trans-unit.target: **Web role**

trans-unit.source: Runs Windows Server with your web app automatically deployed to IIS.
trans-unit.target: Runs Windows Server with your web app automatically deployed to IIS.

trans-unit.source: **Worker role**
trans-unit.target: **Worker role**

trans-unit.source: Runs Windows Server without IIS.
trans-unit.target: Runs Windows Server without IIS.

trans-unit.source: For example, a simple application might use just a web role, while a more complex application might use a web role to handle incoming requests from users, then pass the work those requests create to a worker role for processing.
trans-unit.target: For example, a simple application might use just a web role, while a more complex application might use a web role to handle incoming requests from users, then pass the work those requests create to a worker role for processing.

trans-unit.source: As the figure above suggests, all of the VMs in a single application run in the same cloud service.
trans-unit.target: As the figure above suggests, all of the VMs in a single application run in the same cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, users access the application through a single public IP address, with requests automatically load balanced across the application's VMs.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, users access the application through a single public IP address, with requests automatically load balanced across the application's VMs.

trans-unit.source: The platform will [scale and deploy](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-how-to-scale.md) the VMs in a Cloud Services application in a way that avoids a single point of hardware failure.
trans-unit.target: The platform will [scale and deploy](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-how-to-scale.md) the VMs in a Cloud Services application in a way that avoids a single point of hardware failure.

trans-unit.source: Even though applications run in virtual machines, it's important to understand that Cloud Services provides PaaS, not IaaS.
trans-unit.target: Even though applications run in virtual machines, it's important to understand that Cloud Services provides PaaS, not IaaS.

trans-unit.source: Here's one way to think about it: With IaaS, such as Azure Virtual Machines, you first create and configure the environment your application will run in, then deploy your application into this environment.
trans-unit.target: Here's one way to think about it: With IaaS, such as Azure Virtual Machines, you first create and configure the environment your application will run in, then deploy your application into this environment.

trans-unit.source: You're responsible for managing much of this world, doing things such as deploying new patched versions of the operating system in each VM.
trans-unit.target: You're responsible for managing much of this world, doing things such as deploying new patched versions of the operating system in each VM.

trans-unit.source: In PaaS, by contrast, it's as if the environment already exists.
trans-unit.target: In PaaS, by contrast, it's as if the environment already exists.

trans-unit.source: All you have to do is deploy your application.
trans-unit.target: All you have to do is deploy your application.

trans-unit.source: Management of the platform it runs on, including deploying new versions of the operating system, is handled for you.
trans-unit.target: Management of the platform it runs on, including deploying new versions of the operating system, is handled for you.

trans-unit.source: Scaling and management
trans-unit.target: Scaling and management

trans-unit.source: With Cloud Services, you don't create virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: With Cloud Services, you don't create virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you provide a configuration file that tells Azure how many of each you'd like, such as **three web role instances** and **two worker role instances**, and the platform creates them for you.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you provide a configuration file that tells Azure how many of each you'd like, such as **three web role instances** and **two worker role instances**, and the platform creates them for you.

trans-unit.source: You still choose [what size](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-sizes-specs.md) those backing VMs should be, but you don't explicitly create them yourself.
trans-unit.target: You still choose [what size](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-sizes-specs.md) those backing VMs should be, but you don't explicitly create them yourself.

trans-unit.source: If your application needs to handle a greater load, you can ask for more VMs, and Azure will create those instances.
trans-unit.target: If your application needs to handle a greater load, you can ask for more VMs, and Azure will create those instances.

trans-unit.source: If the load decreases, you can shut those instances down and stop paying for them.
trans-unit.target: If the load decreases, you can shut those instances down and stop paying for them.

trans-unit.source: A Cloud Services application is typically made available to users via a two-step process.
trans-unit.target: A Cloud Services application is typically made available to users via a two-step process.

trans-unit.source: A developer first [uploads the application](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy.md) to the platform's staging area.
trans-unit.target: A developer first [uploads the application](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy.md) to the platform's staging area.

trans-unit.source: When the developer is ready to make the application live, they use the Azure Management Portal to request that it be put into production.
trans-unit.target: When the developer is ready to make the application live, they use the Azure Management Portal to request that it be put into production.

trans-unit.source: This [switch between staging and production](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-nodejs-stage-application.md) can be done with no downtime, which lets a running application be upgraded to a new version without disturbing its users.
trans-unit.target: This [switch between staging and production](../articles/cloud-services/cloud-services-nodejs-stage-application.md) can be done with no downtime, which lets a running application be upgraded to a new version without disturbing its users.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Monitoring

trans-unit.source: Cloud Services also provides monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Cloud Services also provides monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Like Azure Virtual Machines, it will detect a failed physical server and restart the VMs that were running on that server on a new machine.
trans-unit.target: Like Azure Virtual Machines, it will detect a failed physical server and restart the VMs that were running on that server on a new machine.

trans-unit.source: But Cloud Services also detects failed VMs and applications, not just hardware failures.
trans-unit.target: But Cloud Services also detects failed VMs and applications, not just hardware failures.

trans-unit.source: Unlike Virtual Machines, it has an agent inside each web and worker role, and so it's able to start new VMs and application instances when failures occur.
trans-unit.target: Unlike Virtual Machines, it has an agent inside each web and worker role, and so it's able to start new VMs and application instances when failures occur.

trans-unit.source: The PaaS nature of Cloud Services has other implications, too.
trans-unit.target: The PaaS nature of Cloud Services has other implications, too.

trans-unit.source: One of the most important is that applications built on this technology should be written to run correctly when any web or worker role instance fails.
trans-unit.target: One of the most important is that applications built on this technology should be written to run correctly when any web or worker role instance fails.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this, a Cloud Services application shouldn't maintain state in the file system of its own VMs.
trans-unit.target: To achieve this, a Cloud Services application shouldn't maintain state in the file system of its own VMs.

trans-unit.source: Unlike VMs created with Azure Virtual Machines, writes made to Cloud Services VMs aren't persistent; there's nothing like a Virtual Machines data disk.
trans-unit.target: Unlike VMs created with Azure Virtual Machines, writes made to Cloud Services VMs aren't persistent; there's nothing like a Virtual Machines data disk.

trans-unit.source: Instead, a Cloud Services application should explicitly write all state to SQL Database, blobs, tables, or some other external storage.
trans-unit.target: Instead, a Cloud Services application should explicitly write all state to SQL Database, blobs, tables, or some other external storage.

trans-unit.source: Building applications this way makes them easier to scale and more resistant to failure, both important goals of Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: Building applications this way makes them easier to scale and more resistant to failure, both important goals of Cloud Services.
